bibl.title: Letter from J.G. Woods to James E. Peabody, February 16, 1935

div1.p: Woods sends Peabody a transcription of a 1914 letter from Henry Cabot Lodge to Theodore Roosevelt.

div1.head: Letter from J.G. Woods to James E. Peabody, February 16, 1935
div1.opener:
54 Eleanor Road
Springfield, Mass.
February 16, 1935
Mr. J. E. Peabody
El Cortez, Winter Park
Florida
Dear J.:
div1.p:
In my reading I came across an item which I
thought would interest you as it did me, and so I
have taken pains to made a careful copy from Mr. Lodge's
letter to mail you herewith. Etta's fountain pen did
not act well, but I reason that you will wish to make
a typewritten copy so that the blots in my scrawl will
not matter. All well here with snow in abundant supply,
but spring signs noticeable.
